Description: Fragment of neck and complete round handle, ht. 13, from a Brindisi pottery transport amphora. Clay near fine brick red; light brown surface; white inclusions. Rectangular stamp on side of handle with Latin inscription.
Curator's comments: Names, Tarula and Sulla. cf. Desy, Ph., Les timbres amphoriques de l'Apulie republicaine (Oxford 1989) 170. P. Palazzo, Le anfore di Apani (Brindisi), Rome 2013, 157-8. Petrie diary, 1884-1885 (EES Archive XVII 47), p. 28, 20.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (JB.1301)
Associated names: Named in inscription: Lucius Cornelius Sulla (?)
